newsitem.title: USA: Adviser calls Rhodes deal grossly inadequate.
newsitem.headline: Adviser calls Rhodes deal grossly inadequate.

text.p: Southeastern Asset Mangement Inc on Tuesday said a proposed merger deal between Rhodes Inc and Heilig-Meyers Co was "grossly inadequate."
In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the Memphis, Tenn.,-based investment adviser also called the deal "unfair" to shareholders.

Southeastern, which holds a 17.4 percent stake in Rhodes, suggested that the Rhodes board "should be willing to seek and consider other altneratives such as a more beneficial offer for the company or the possiblity of remaining independent."

Under the proposed deal announced on September 17, Rhodes shareholders will receive one Heilig-Meyer common share for each two shares of Rhodes. The deal is subject to anti-trust clearance, approval of Rhodes shareholders and other conditions.
Southeastern said its efforts to hold discussions with Halcombe Green Jr, the former Rhodes chairman whose group contrlols a 31.9 percent stake in Rhodes, "has been unsuccessful."
